body:
On Ruqqus, posts can move between guilds, by getting kicked or yanked to/from +general. This allows guildmasters (moderators) to curate the content in their guild (by kicking stuff that doesn't belong) without censoring users (because the content still shows up organically elsewhere).

So the post was in +Ruqqus. The user made a comment and was exiled for that comment. Later on, the post was kicked to +general, then yanked to +dumpsterfire.

parent.body:
On Ruqqus, posts can move between guilds, by getting kicked or yanked to/from +general. This allows guildmasters (moderators) to curate the content in their guild (by kicking stuff that doesn't belong) without censoring users (because the content still shows up organically elsewhere).

So the post was in +Ruqqus. The user made a comment and was exiled for that comment. Later on, the post was kicked to +general, then yanked to +dumpsterfire.

body:
As long as the contemporary "acceptance" (anti free-speech) movement continues to gain momentum the average person will always feel bewildered by seeing unacceptable speech and therefore reject using the platform on principle.

However, Ruqqus has very competent (not mentally unstable) admins that seem committed to finding some kind of balance.

With growth continuing, I believe it has the potential to become a kind of sanctuary for people with dissenting views. Contingent on that happening, which seems likely with current political trends, I think it will gain popular respect. 

But as long as people continue to relegate these websites to "alt-right collectives", it will always be detestable to use them. That's exactly why we need someone (like the admins) that respect popular perception, and are willing to make it more pleasant to the average user. 

I continue to believe we NEED more political diversity on here. I'm a left-leaning person and I've made it my sole intention to contest and debate. This is not just for intellectual curiosity, but because every thread that remains an echo chamber will delegitimize Ruqqus to the media (and visitors). We need more of this, for Ruqqus to be considered a spectrum, rather than an echo chamber.

body: This obviously does not really work, if the non-free guilds are controlled by admins, who naturally get the benefit of the doubt AND can sticky all of their threads to the front page, no matter how many downvotes they would eventually get, even if trust in the admins decreases (which really takes a long time, because they usually get a lot more sympathy naturally)

parent.body:
Guilds should have the right to ban at their own discretion. The free market should do its wonders, meaning that these totalitarian guilds will eventually die, since users will move to freer guilds. If user do not leave, that would mean that they agree, at some level, with the decision.

If you get banned from the page itself, that would be an issue. In any case, I have my expectations low, and I am ready to jump out of the boat as soon as I see this web going to trash.

post.title: Huh? - This was my only post in +Ruqqus and I got banned

body:
Is not about downvotes, is about active users. If users as a whole truly do not approve of the banning measures, and they have the option of participating in another guild that offers a freer platform, then it is only logical to assume that these people will tend to the freer guilds.

Saying that the admins have a natural benefit of the doubt is not enough to guarantee that users will stay. That benefit can be lost by the individual opinion of users. Otherwise, all of us would be using reddit in the first place.

If admins abuse their powers to stick their own posts, users will notice. And if necessary, will leave Ruqqus to die and move to the next best platform, the same way many of us left Reddit. The fact that it takes time does not mean it doesn't work. Simply means it takes time.

If you believe admins are not being fair, you should leave. That's what I did in Reddit and what I'm prepared to do here in Ruqqus if they fuck it up. If you believe users do not gravitate to freer guilds, then might as well go and use Reddit, since the whole purpose of Ruqqus is the same exercise at a bigger scale.
